Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that segments of the 1776 Commission report were taken from earlier writings by two commission members.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that segments of the report were indeed copied from earlier writings, as confirmed by multiple reports and sources.
Exaggerate: The claim does not appear to exaggerate any aspect of the situation.
Understate: The claim does not appear to understate any aspect of the situation.
Falters at times: The claim does not appear to falter at any point.
Problematic assumption: The claim does not rely on any problematic assumptions.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not provide an alternative explanation for the existence of segments of copied text in the report.
